title: Tuesday morning news briefing: Brexit talks on a knife edge
text:

Brexit: Deal hopes rise as 'last-minute compromises are made'

A Brexit deal appears to be taking shape. Sources on both sides of the Channel insist a positive day of negotiations yielded a potential solution to the Northern Irish border problem. Key figures in Brussels and London told Europe Editor Peter Foster there was "cautious optimism". With talks on a knife edge, Boris Johnson has cancelled today's Cabinet meeting to avoid the potential for leaks that could derail delicate discussions. At the heart of a possible breakthrough is understood to be a hybrid compromise solution on the question of Irish customs checks. Here is a simple reminder of why the issue is so crucial. With Mr Johnson facing a battle to avoid becoming the first PM since 1924 to lose a vote on a Queen's Speech, here is everything that was announced topic by topic. And Matt features one of the unspoken effects of the speech in today's cartoon.

Meanwhile, in Labour… Jeremy Corbyn's closest aide has been warned he is next "on the list" to be forced out, amid claims that John McDonnell is engaged in a "Soviet-style" purge of the party leader's office. Insiders have told Political Correspondent Harry Yorke there are growing calls for ex-Guardian journalist Seumas Milne to be removed as Mr Corbyn's communications director.
